hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp (>5%) intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines) but aggregate exchange reserves show net inflows within 24 hours, price will mean-revert 70% of the drop within 48 hours as opportunistic buyers absorb panic selling.
hypothesis_content.rationale: October's 'liquidity crash' created structural gaps where panic selling was absorbed by institutional accumulation. News-driven drops in neutral/bull regimes often see faster recovery when on-chain data shows accumulation.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour close down >5% from previous day's close
Negative macro news headline score >0.7 (sentiment analysis)
Aggregate exchange net flow turns positive within 24h of drop (CryptoQuant/Glassnode)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the initial drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new low below initial drop candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of signals result in continuation below entry price beyond 48h window
